title: Boxes should be handed out to people who get a lot of unique honor.
body: To make this work we'd have to limit the amount someone can honor othersin a day so people cant just always honor each other. But we should have a certian amount of honor you get you get a box or a key for crafting or even crafting dust. This would promote being a more sportsman like person.  But when honored everything for the crafting boxes you must be honored by unique people they cant be the same person over and over. This would stop friends from honoring each other over and over just for boxes. As well anyone below level 30's honor doesnt count so they cant just make smurfs and honor themselves or friends in a bot game or otherwise. THis isnt flawless please critique my idea to make sure it cant be exploited

replies.body: Problem is, nobody actually honors (at least in my games) . I think that the main issue with honoring is that it has been forgotten by most players.

I always honor everyone on the winning team. I try to stay positive, tell people when they do a good job, never flame, and tell the enemy good fight if we had a close 1 v 1.  
But I feel like I never get honors. So I'd just he boxless forever. 

Also, I feel like itd discourage people from honoring. Salty your team lost? No honors. Salty your junglers red buff last hit a kill? No honor. Someone lost lane even with a late game champ? No honor. Feel like everybody sucks but you on your team? No honor.

This could work and limiting the amount one can give out would incentivize people to honor those that are actually honorable not the people who just ask for it.

Really like this idea.
The only problem i see is the potential to absolutely hoard keys. Right now, i have 13 keys AFTER opening boxes.
Maybe they could be milestones for honor for 100,500,1000 etc or every x honor you get you get 1 box.
I guess this would be a cool way to revive the honour system. Cool
